name: limestone, crushed, washed to generic market for supplementary cementitious materials | supplementary cementitious materials | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/27095/documentation

This activity is a renaming activity, linking limestone, crushed, washed to the generic market for supplementary cementitious materials (SCM).;Limestone is a mineral widely used as aggregate in concrete. The process of crushing of limestone to produce aggregates generates fines called limestone powder (LP). About 20% of the limestone production is such powder (Sakir et al., 2020). This powder, which cannot be used as aggregate to produce concrete, can serve as partial substitute of cement (Souza et al., 2020). Limestone powder can act as a filler in cement hydration. Replacing part of the Portland cement with limestone increases the effective water to cement ratio, and provides additional surface for precipitation of hydration products, thereby promoting the early age hydration of the Portland cement (Torkaman et al., 2014).;Sources:;;Sakir, S., Raman, S. N., Safiuddin, M., Kaish, A. B. M., & Mutalib, A. A. (2020). Utilization of By-Products and Wastes as Supplementary Cementitious Materials in Structural Mortar for Sustainable Construction. Sustainability, 12(9), 3888.;;Souza, A. T., Barbosa, T. F., Riccio, L. A., & dos Santos, W. J. (2020). Effect of limestone powder substitution on mechanical properties and durability of slender precast components of structural mortar. Journal of Materials Research and Technology, 9(1), 847-856;;Torkaman, J., Ashori, A., & Momtazi, A. S. (2014). Using wood fiber waste, rice husk ash, and limestone powder waste as cement replacement materials for lightweight concrete blocks. Construction and building materials, 50, 432-436.

The activity starts with the input of limestone, crushed, washed.

With the provision of a generic kg of supplementary cementitious materials.
